DataElement.preferredName: High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Neoplasia Consistent Pap Smear Assessment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/no indicator to signify a pap smear consistent with HSIL

DataElementConcept.preferredName: High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Neoplasia Consistent Pap Smear Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Related to a pap smear consistent with HSIL

ObjectClass.preferredName: High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Neoplasia Consistent Pap Smear
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A precancerous neoplastic process characterized by the presence of moderate or severe dysplastic cytological changes which extend to the upper part of the squamous epithelium.  Maturation at the surface of the squamous epithelium may or may not be present.  Representative examples include the high grade esophageal squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade cervical squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, and high grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia.:Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.:A procedure in which cells are scraped from the cervix for examination under a microscope. It is used to detect cancer and changes that may lead to cancer. A Pap smear can also show conditions, such as infection or inflammation, that are not cancer.

Concepts.definition: A precancerous neoplastic process characterized by the presence of moderate or severe dysplastic cytological changes which extend to the upper part of the squamous epithelium.  Maturation at the surface of the squamous epithelium may or may not be present.  Representative examples include the high grade esophageal squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade cervical squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, and high grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia.
Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.

A biospecimen collection and staining procedure in which secretions and superficial cells of the cervix are collected and stained with the Papanicolaou stain followed by microscopic examination to identify the presence of abnormal cells.
